image.altText: Photos from the Paris Olympic Games Opening Ceremony spliced together

props.synopsis: From Lady Gaga making her highly anticipated appearance to an incredibly emotional conclusion with Celine Dion — here's the biggest moments from the opening ceremony.

title.children: From Gaga to beheadings to Celine's magic moment — here's all the highlights from the opening ceremony

image.altText: A photo of an unidentifiable man stroking his beard.

props.synopsis: Victorian men with religious beards are banned from working as paramedics due to a rigid face mask policy, despite alternative mask fit techniques being used in other states and countries.

title.children: 'Very frustrated': Sikh community accuses Victoria's ambulance service of discrimination due to religious beard ban

image.altText: Marie-José Pérec

props.synopsis: Speculation was rife before the opening ceremony about who was going to light the Olympic cauldron. While some predictions came true, others were way off the mark.

title.children: Tennis champs and French legends — here's the full cast of sporting champions who carried the torch to the Olympic cauldron

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in front of the Eiffel Tower, which is lit up in a light show

props.synopsis: Simply pulling off this opening ceremony is a feat for Paris to be proud of. But as the city of lights danced in the rain, it sent the world a message and proved again the real value of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Paris, soaked but spectacular, delivers an opening ceremony for the dreamers

image.altText: a 32yo man with facial hair wearing a white shirt and backwards cap

props.synopsis: Zak Grieve spent his 20s incarcerated alongside some of the Northern Territory's worst criminals. Now on parole, his life as a convicted murderer is under the microscope.

title.children: The judge knew Zak Grieve didn't commit murder. NT laws meant he got a life sentence anyway

image.altText: A young boy sits on the floor smiling, holding up a tennis racket

props.synopsis: The news headline told of cold-blooded murder, but the face staring back at me was that of my childhood friend, writes Josh Robertson.

title.children: How my friend turned from tennis prodigy into an unhinged killer

image.altText: An older man and woman smiling while hugging on their front porch.

props.synopsis: Desperate to escape financial turmoil in the wake of the pandemic and rising interest rates, this city couple changed their lives completely and haven't looked back.

title.children: Couple goes from struggling to repay mortgage and $80,000 credit card debt to owning their own home

image.altText: A ring of fire propelling a hot air balloon into the sky.

props.synopsis: The Paris Olympics officially begin following a spectacular — but rain-dampened — opening ceremony held on the Seine, climaxing with a suspenseful torch relay and a breathtaking performance from Céline Dion.

title.children: Cauldron lit and launched into the air as Aussies shine in Olympics opening ceremony

image.altText: IV drip in hospital near closed blinds.

props.synopsis: Health authorities have assured the public there is ample supply of IV fluids for humans in hospitals, but have begun making moves to conserve stock levels of the crucial substance.

title.children: A critical fluid used in health care to rehydrate and administer drugs to patients is experiencing a global supply shortage. Here's how it'll affect you

image.altText: A line of people

props.synopsis: Electrical Trades Union members have walked out of the New South Wales Labor Party conference in Sydney as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese delivered a speech to party faithful.

title.children: Union members walk out on Albanese's speech at NSW Labor conference

image.altText: Trump and Netanyahu sitting at a long table with other officials.

props.synopsis: Former US president Donald Trump has sat down with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for their first face-to-face meeting in nearly four years.

title.children: Trump touts warm ties with Netanyahu during Mar-a-Lago meeting

image.altText: Two woman shake hands with a man with an American flag draped behind them

props.synopsis: In the last three weeks, one woman has emerged as the key driver of efforts to push the Democratic Party towards a historic decision. Here's how Nancy Pelosi helped put Kamala Harris on the ticket.

title.children: The woman who showed Biden the door: 'Nancy made clear they could do this the easy way or the hard way'

image.altText: An aerial shot of Huione Pay's headquarters in Phnom Penh.

props.synopsis: A huge online marketplace linked to Cambodia's ruling family is allegedly being used to sell equipment to and launder money for the online scam industry — with Australians among those in the crosshairs.

title.children: Cambodian online marketplace outed as one-stop shop for scammers' money laundering and 'detention equipment' needs

image.altText: an indigenous woman with a black ponytail wears a top with a green and yellow wattle design, the bush in the background

props.synopsis: Aboriginal leaders across the country have paid tribute to outgoing Indigenous Affairs Minister Linda Burney. Here's who is expected to replace her.

title.children: A cabinet reshuffle is days away and this is the top pick for Minister Burney's role

image.altText: Olga Korbut flies through the air backwards while doing a gymnastics routine, in a full stadium.

props.synopsis: The 1972 Munich Olympics was the first games I can recall, and it imprinted me forever — especially the astonishing routines of a Soviet Union gymnast whose signature move was so dangerous that it's now banned.

title.children: My first Olympics imprinted on me forever — and nothing has compared since

image.altText: A crowded train station

props.synopsis: Fires started in railway cabling have impacted up to 800,000 people across the French railway network on the eve of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: France's high-speed rail network hit by arson attacks hours before Paris Games begin

image.altText: Patty Mills during a Boomers warm up

props.synopsis: Through controversial selection, an aggressive game style and brash confidence, the Boomers are putting all their chips in at the Paris Olympics — and in what might be the most competitive Games ever, it's gold or bust for the Aussies.

title.children: Gold vibes only — the Boomers have the band back together, and aren't settling for bronze

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair sits looking serious with her glasses in one hand.

props.synopsis: Violent civil unrest and a brutal government crackdown in Bangladesh have left the diaspora in Canberra reeling.

title.children: Shamaruh called her parents in Bangladesh but couldn't hear their voices properly

image.altText: A man with black hair wears a white and blue collared shirt speaking to someone out of shot

props.synopsis: Staff and family members of the three leaders say they have been taken to an unknown location by police.

title.children: Bangladesh police accused of removing protest leaders from hospital

image.altText: Clare O'Neil looks towards Anthony Albanese at a joint press conference in the Prime Minister's courtyard at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is working the phones with Labor's factional bosses to maintain his government's much-vaunted cohesion as the prime minister moves to refresh a ministry under pressure over immigration, housing and the cost of living.

title.children: Anthony Albanese keeping cabinet reshuffle 'close to his chest'

image.altText: A black coloured tractor in the Antarctic snow with whispy clouds across the blue sky. A large halo surrounds the sun.

props.synopsis: The temperature above the east Antarctic coastline warmed by about 50 degrees Celsius in a week earlier in July. The event, called a Sudden Stratospheric Warming has the potential to impact Australia's weather through August and possibly well into spring.

title.children: The temperature over Antarctica rose by 50C in a week — here's how it could impact Australia

image.altText: Palestinians inspect the damage caused at a mosque in central Gaza Strip

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese releases a joint statement with the leaders of Canada and New Zealand calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

title.children: Albanese joins Canada and NZ in urging immediate Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A sauna building and change tent on a floating pontoon on a peaceful lake.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's tourism sector has seized upon the long-standing European tradition of saunas. Enjoyed especially in cooler weather, saunas have started appearing all over the state.

title.children: Good for the body and mind: getting hot in the coldest state

image.altText: Man wearing black t shirt and grey beanie places pork ribs into a metal bbq smoker in a home backyard

props.synopsis: There's been an "explosive" surge in Australia's smoked meats community, with barbecue community groups serving as inadvertent online men's sheds where meat, mateship and masculinity are all on the menu.

title.children: 'Nailed that, my man': Why the smoked meats community has come to mean so much to men

image.altText: a purple light illuminates a thick web of computer cables in a dark room

props.synopsis: There is a growing sense of unease about global stock markets, and particularly Wall Street, as investors rush to sell off the tech stocks that have recently pushed markets to record highs.

title.children: Wall Street wobbles on Artificial Intelligence concerns

image.altText: A selfie of woman with a fringe in a brown polka dot top

props.synopsis: Over time, women have shared stories of feeling dismissed and ignored by healthcare professionals. Now the results of a national survey hint at just how serious the problem is.

title.children: 'I broke down sobbing because a doctor believed me': Why do so many Australian women experience medical misogyny?

image.altText: Jason Horne-Francis celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide looked gone for all money after Carlton kicked seven goals in the second quarter, only to put together a second half for the ages.

title.children: Carlton stunned as Port Adelaide boosts top-four hopes with remarkable comeback win

image.altText: A police officer stands near a wall painted with the words "Zionism is Fascism".

props.synopsis: Federal Labor MP Josh Burns thanks police for charging a 17- and 18-year-old pair for allegedly anti-Semitic vandalism of his Melbourne office.

title.children: Two teenagers charged over a vandalism attack at federal MP Josh Burns's office

image.altText: Hatsune Miku is singing into a microphone and holding a guitar.

props.synopsis: While doomsayers may see virtual performers like Hatsune Miku and Plave as a threat to the creative industries, some artists are using the technology to their advantage.

title.children: Virtual idol Hatsune Miku has announced her first Aussie tour and she's not the only digital kid on the block

image.altText: A composite image of eight book covers on a green background

props.synopsis: On the list are the latest novel from a Miles Franklin-winning author, a celebration of the nurses on the frontline of the AIDS crisis and a laugh-out-loud foray into lesbian pulp fiction.

title.children: A 'gruesome romp' and 'one of the funniest books of the year': July's best reads

image.altText: Harris in a brown suit smiles looking up at Obama in a black suit in front of a gaudy yellow curtain

props.synopsis: The former US president and his wife throw their support behind the current vice-president as the presumptive Democratic presidential candidate.

title.children: Obamas endorse Kamala Harris's US presidential bid

image.altText: AFL player Cyril Rioli smiling, holding the AFL Premiership Cup, on the parade lap, after winning the grand final

props.synopsis: Rioli has lodged a racism claim in the Federal Court on behalf of his wife and other former First Nations players.

title.children: Former AFL premiership star Cyril Rioli launches fresh court challenge against Hawthorn Football Club over alleged racism
